content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

The target structure appears to be a simple toy car or truck with the following characteristics:

## Count & Layers:
- Total blocks used: 4 blocks
- Layers: 2 layers (base layer with wheels and top layer with the body and roof)

## Spatial Relationships:
- Base layer: Two yellow half-cylinder blocks serving as wheels
- Top layer: One yellow rectangular block as the main body/truck bed
- An orange triangular block sits on top of the yellow rectangular block, serving as a roof or cabin

# Selected Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:

1. Block 5 - Yellow half-cylinder (left wheel)
2. Block 6 - Yellow half-cylinder (right wheel)
3. Block 2 - Yellow horizontal rectangular block (main body/truck bed)
4. Block 14 - Orange triangular block (roof/cabin)

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 5
   Step2: Move block with index 6
   Step3: Move block with index 2
   Step4: Move block with index 14
}
```

The assembly process starts with placing the wheels (blocks 5 and 6) as the foundation, then adding the rectangular body (block 2) on top of them, and finally placing the triangular roof (block 14) on top of the body to complete the structure.
